extendedIngredients.name: brussels sprouts
extendedIngredients.original: 1 pound Brussels sprouts, as uniform in size as possible (See Cook's Note)
extendedIngredients.originalName: Brussels sprouts, as uniform in size as possible (See Cook's Note)

title: Grilled Brussels Sprouts
summary: Need a caveman, gluten free, primal, and whole 30 side dish? Grilled Brussels Sprouts could be an outstanding recipe to try. One portion of this dish contains roughly 4g of protein, 7g of fat, and a total of 115 calories. For 97 cents per serving, this recipe covers 16% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe serves 4. 1 person has tried and liked this recipe. It will be a hit at your The Fourth Of July event. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 23 minutes. A mixture of olive oil, brussels sprouts, garlic, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so delicious. It is brought to you by Foodnetwork. With a spoonacular score of 82%, this dish is outstanding. Try Grilled Brussels Sprouts, Grilled Brussels Sprouts. I like them, and Grilled Savory Brussels Sprouts for similar recipes.
instructions: Watch how to make this recipe.                    Heat a grill to medium.                          Cut off the stem end of the Brussels sprouts and remove any yellowing outer leaves. Place the Brussels sprouts into a large, microwave safe mixing bowl and heat in the microwave on high for 3 minutes. Add the olive oil, garlic, mustard, paprika and salt and toss to combine. Allow the sprouts to cool until you can handle them. Skewer 4 to 5 Brussels sprouts onto each metal skewer with the stem ends facing in the same direction, leaving at least 1/2-inch in between each sprout. Place the skewers onto the grill with stem end closest to the flame. Cover and cook for 5 minutes. Turn the skewers over and continue to cook for another 5 minutes. Serve as is or for additional flavor, remove the sprouts from the skewers, return them to the original mixing bowl and toss with any of the remaining oil and garlic mixture before serving.

steps.step: Watch how to make this recipe.
Cut off the stem end of the Brussels sprouts and remove any yellowing outer leaves.
Place the Brussels sprouts into a large, microwave safe mixing bowl and heat in the microwave on high for 3 minutes.

Add the olive oil, garlic, mustard, paprika and salt and toss to combine. Allow the sprouts to cool until you can handle them. Skewer 4 to 5 Brussels sprouts onto each metal skewer with the stem ends facing in the same direction, leaving at least 1/2-inch in between each sprout.
Place the skewers onto the grill with stem end closest to the flame. Cover and cook for 5 minutes. Turn the skewers over and continue to cook for another 5 minutes.
Serve as is or for additional flavor, remove the sprouts from the skewers, return them to the original mixing bowl and toss with any of the remaining oil and garlic mixture before serving.
